body.head: Lincoln several times visited the hospitals
body.ab: Lincoln several times visited the hospitals I saw him once or twice there In "Lincoln" piece I will carycarry you back to 1858,'9,'60, —rapid picture of the state of things draw a picture of all the election Doubt, dismay, uncertainity, of the great 1859, '60,'61— A grea
The nation far more divided and distracted than has ever been acknowledged—the slavery spirit—the secession spirit largely in the north—in some parts dominating all—as in

the city of N.Y. for instance—every this doubtful—gloom every—death I ruin, death, treachery, dissolution, lurking every where, ready to happen, ready to spring forth——questionable indeed Which was the readiest ruin?—submission to the secessionists? or war upon this—In the midst of these a tall

the enormous & gross vulgarity of our nomin political nominations, with & the utter heartlessness our general politics, elections, &c., threatening going on from wo worse & worse, otherwise to draw all the warm blood out of the life of the country.
